Any reuse of the material should credit the Walt Whitman Archive.

notesStmt.note: Recto of manuscript is stamped "308" in lower left corner.Verso of manuscript leaf is a table of contents for the Christian Examiner, No. 198 from November, 1856, which includes the authors' names and the cities they are from.

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: How will it do for figure?
bibl.orgName: The Thomas Biggs Harned Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1842–1937, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

div1.head: (How will it is for figure?)
div1.ab:
Get a perfect account of the attack and taking of the Bastille (fire, blood, smoke, death, shouts, attack, desperation)
fSymbol of the attack on the bulwarks slavery in These States—
The stern masses of the north, stern
and muscular
The enthusiasts not only of these
lands, but of all lands.
The determined purpose—death does
not stop it—it is filled
with by others—and their death
of others still.—.
